arts.ttl: Burnley FC player ratings vs Coventry as three 8/10s help Clarets ease to third win in a row
arts.sum: On a bitterly cold night at Turf Moor it was Jeremy Sarmiento who provided the spark for the Clarets as they produced a dominant display against a well-organised Coventry side.

arts.ttl: Rhys Carr on Coventry City managerial latest and his role moving forwards
arts.sum: Asked if he’s enjoyed his spell in charge so far, Carr said: “Someone asked me that the other day and because of the way the lads have applied themselves and the levels of commitment they are showing to the club and he team, that has made me proud and that’s a credit to the players and the team. As for his own future and whether he’s hoping to be part of the club’s plans moving forward beyond the new appointment, Carr was keen to put the club before himself, saying: “Yeah, whatever is the right decision for Coventry City is the right thing to do.

arts.ttl: Rhys Carr reflects on 'fine margins' as Coventry City 'gutted' by first defeat under his charge
arts.sum: The Sky Blues caretaker felt his players were unlucky with Ephron Mason-Clark’s disallowed overhead kick goal that would have pulled City level, and then Burnley’s second goal that sealed the three points for the Clarets at Turf Moor. “They keep the ball well and they did tonight, to be fair to them, and we felt like they had a bit of control in the first ten to 15 minutes,” said Carr, speaking after the 2-0 away defeat.
Burnley moved up to second in the Sky Bet Championship as they secured a third successive victory by beating managerless Coventry 2-0 at Turf Moor.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings after spectacular disallowed goal denies comeback against Burnley - Andy Turner
arts.sum: But a minute later in the 80th Burnley doubled their lead when CJ Egan-Riley got away from Latibeaudiere in the box and moved to the byline before looping a cross-cum-shot over Brad Collins and watched as it dropped in over the line as three white City shirts attempted and fail to clear it. The forward laid the ball out wide to Jaidon Anthony who played it to Connor Roberts who took it to the byline and pulled it back into the box where Sarmiento was unmarked to side foot home with an easy finish to give the Clarents the lead.

arts.ttl: Burnley up to second following victory against Coventry
arts.sum: Goals from Jeremy Sarmiento and CJ Egan-Riley eased the Clarets to victory.

arts.ttl: Josh Brownhill missing as Scott Parker makes two changes for Coventry clash
arts.sum: The official team news from Burnley’s clash with Championship rivals Coventry City at Turf Moor.

arts.ttl: NFL legend JJ Watt congratulates Jay Rodriguez on reaching 300 appearances for Burnley FC
arts.sum: JJ Watt has recorded a special message for Jay Rodriguez as the club prepares to pay tribute to the striker’s 300 appearances ahead of tonight’s match with Coventry City.

arts.ttl: Burnley v Coventry City: Team news, predicted teams and TV details as Clarets aim for three wins on the bounce
arts.sum: Burnley will be looking to make it three wins in a row for the first time this season when they take on a Coventry side winless in three.

arts.ttl: Burnley manager Scott Parker happy to see 'unbelievable human being' Massengo’ back
arts.sum: Scott Parker is hopeful 'ultimate human being' Han-Noah Massengo can now get some minutes under his belt after returning to the side against Bristol City.
